required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laparotomy Closure Techniques: do Surgeons Follow the Latest Guidelines? Results of a Questionnaire.
clinical_study.official_title: Laparotomy Closure Techniques: do Surgeons Follow the Latest Guidelines? Results of a Questionnaire.

brief_summary.textblock: Incisional hernias after laparotomy are associated with significant morbidity and increased costs. Research is focused on development of new techniques to prevent incisional hernia. Little is known about application of this evidence in daily practice. Therefore, a survey was performed among Dutch surgeons.

detailed_description.textblock:
Incisional hernias after laparotomy are associated with significant morbidity and increased costs. Research is focused on development of new techniques to prevent incisional hernia. Little is known about application of this evidence in daily practice. Therefore, a survey was performed among Dutch surgeons.
All members of the Dutch Surgical Society were invited to participate in a 24-question online survey on techniques and materials used for abdominal wall closure after midline laparotomy. Subgroup analysis based on surgical subspecialty, hospital and experience was performed.

primary_outcome.measure: opinions on and current technique used for laparotomy closure
primary_outcome.time_frame: July till August 2016 at survey completion; snapshot measurement
July till August 2016 at survey completion; ; snapshot measurement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- surgeon in the Netherlands
Exclusion Criteria:
- not practicing surgery
- not practicing in the Netherlands

patient_data.ipd_description: anonymous individual data will be provided upon request
